title: Prysm hangs at INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain endpoint=/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc
body:
<!--💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎
Having issues syncing prsym
Using version, on centos 8 using a external solid state hdd
Prysm/v1.0.5/2428880058c0e8183bd33ec04c3a0656ec471deb.

Hangs at the bellow:

Starting Prysm beacon-chain --clear-db --http-web3provider=/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc --verbosity debug
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  WARN flags: Running on ETH2 Mainnet
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  INFO flags: Using "max_cover" strategy on attestation aggregation
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  INFO node: Checking DB database-path=/mnt/ssd/.eth2/beaconchaindata
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  WARN node: This will delete your beacon chain database stored in your data directory. Your database backups will not be removed - do you want to proceed? (Y/N)
>> y
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  WARN node: Removing database
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG p2p: ECDSA private key generated
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO node: Deposit contract: 0x
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO initial-sync: Waiting for state to be initialized
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO node: Starting beacon node version=Prysm/v1.0.5/2428880058c0e8183bd33ec04c3a0656ec471deb. Built at: 2020-12-14 17:23:54+00:00
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting 9 services: [*p2p.Service *powchain.Service *attestations.Service *blockchain.Service *initialsync.Service *sync.Service *rpc.Service *gateway.Gateway *prometheus.Service]
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *p2p.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *powchain.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *attestations.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *blockchain.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *initialsync.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *sync.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *rpc.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *gateway.Gateway
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *prometheus.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO blockchain: Waiting to reach the validator deposit threshold to start the beacon chain...
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO gateway: Starting JSON-HTTP API address=127.0.0.1:3500
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO rpc: gRPC server listening on port address=127.0.0.1:4000
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  WARN rpc: You are using an insecure gRPC server. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to enable secure connections, see: https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/secure-grpc
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG prometheus: Starting prometheus service address=127.0.0.1:8080
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain endpoint=/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc

Just hangs at INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain

💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎-->

# 💎 Issue

### Background

<!-- ✍️--> Context and background information on the discussion...

### Description

Doesnt seem to want to go further then.

INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain.

USing centos 8 Prysm v1.0.5/

Verified /mnt/ssd/prysm/dist/beacon-chain-v1.0.5-linux-amd64 has been signed by Prysmatic Labs.
Starting Prysm beacon-chain --clear-db --http-web3provider=/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc --verbosity debug
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  WARN flags: Running on ETH2 Mainnet
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  INFO flags: Using "max_cover" strategy on attestation aggregation
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  INFO node: Checking DB database-path=/mnt/ssd/.eth2/beaconchaindata
[2020-12-23 07:57:55]  WARN node: This will delete your beacon chain database stored in your data directory. Your database backups will not be removed - do you want to proceed? (Y/N)
>> y
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  WARN node: Removing database
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG p2p: ECDSA private key generated
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO node: Deposit contract: 0x
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO initial-sync: Waiting for state to be initialized
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO node: Starting beacon node version=Prysm/v1.0.5/2428880058c0e8183bd33ec04c3a0656ec471deb. Built at: 2020-12-14 17:23:54+00:00
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting 9 services: [*p2p.Service *powchain.Service *attestations.Service *blockchain.Service *initialsync.Service *sync.Service *rpc.Service *gateway.Gateway *prometheus.Service]
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *p2p.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *powchain.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *attestations.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *blockchain.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *initialsync.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *sync.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *rpc.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *gateway.Gateway
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG registry: Starting service type *prometheus.Service
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO blockchain: Waiting to reach the validator deposit threshold to start the beacon chain...
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO gateway: Starting JSON-HTTP API address=127.0.0.1:3500
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO rpc: gRPC server listening on port address=127.0.0.1:4000
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  WARN rpc: You are using an insecure gRPC server. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to enable secure connections, see: https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/secure-grpc
[2020-12-23 07:57:59] DEBUG prometheus: Starting prometheus service address=127.0.0.1:8080
[2020-12-23 07:57:59]  INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain endpoint=/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc
I just didnt wait long enough, I have had so many issues try to get eth2 staking =
